description: Looking ahead to MozCon 2024, we’re unveiling the first 15 speakers who will be taking the stage come June.
content: Sneak Peek: The MozCon 2024 Speaker Line-Up Moz News | SEO Events By: Cheryl Draper November 29, 2023 Table of Contents Copied! By: Cheryl Draper November 29, 2023 Sneak Peek: The MozCon 2024 Speaker Line-Up Moz News | SEO Events Edited by Emilie Martin 2023 may be nearly wrapped up, but before you log off that laptop and say see you next year, we’ve got an extra special, early gift to share. We’re thrilled to announce the first 15 extraordinary speakers that will be taking the MozCon 2024 stage in Seattle this coming June (in alphabetical order): Snag your extremely early bird ticket now! Meet the speakers Amanda Jordan Director of Digital Strategy, RicketyRoo @amandatjordan | @ricketyroo Amanda is passionate about helping complex, large businesses improve their local visibility. Her background includes working with clients in the legal, health, financial, and home services industries.Andy Crestodina Co-founder & Chief Marketing Officer, Orbit Media @crestodina | @orbiteers Andy is the co-founder of Orbit Media, an award-winning 50-person digital agency in Chicago. Over the past 20 years, Andy has provided digital marketing advice to 1000+ businesses and written 500+ articles on content strategy, SEO, visitor psychology, Analytics, and, most recently, AI. Azeem Ahmad Global Digital Marketing Lead, Azeem Digital @AzeemDigital Azeem is a global digital marketer & renowned international speaker who hosts the top-rated podcast "Azeem Digital Asks." With years of experience managing large marketing budgets, he excels in SEO, PPC, Social Media, Programmatic, Audio/Video, and Display. Bethan Vincent Managing Partner, Open Velocity @bethanvincent | @openvelocity Bethan is the founder and Managing Partner of Open Velocity, a leading marketing strategy consultancy. They have spent the last 13 years leading marketing departments and wrangling stakeholders in highly competitive tech and e-commerce businesses. Bernard Huang Co-founder, Clearscope @bernardjhuang| @clearscope Bernard is the co-founder of Clearscope, the leading optimization software for high-quality content teams. Before Clearscope, Bernard started an SEO consulting agency, was a growth advisor in residence at 500 Startups, and led growth at a YC startup called 42Floors. Chima Mmeje Senior Content Marketing Manager, Moz @chimammeje | @moz Chima is a content marketer with a specialty in building and executing topic clusters for product-led tech companies. She's also the founder of The Freelance Coalition for Developing Countries, a UK nonprofit providing free resources for BIPOC marketers. Crystal Carter Head of SEO Communications, Wix @CrystalontheWeb | @wix Head of SEO Communications, Wix, Crystal is an SEO & digital marketer with over 15 years of experience. Her clients have included Disney, McDonalds, and Tomy. An avid SEO communicator, her work has been featured at Google Search Central, Brighton SEO, and more. Dana DiTomaso Founder & Lead Instructor, Kick Point Playbook @danaditomaso | @kp_playbook Dana is the Founder & Lead Instructor at KP Playbook. Alongside the team at Kick Point, Dana teaches people and teams how to set goals and track results so that they understand what strategies and tactics bring real value. Joy Hawkins Owner, Sterling Sky Inc @joyannehawkins | @SterlingSkyInc Joy is the owner of the Local Search Forum, LocalU, and Sterling Sky, a local SEOLocal SEO agency in Canada & the USA. She has been working in the industry since 2006. You can find her on Twitter or volunteering as a Product Expert on the Google Business Profile Forum. Joel Klettke Founder, Case Study Buddy @joelklettke | @casestudybuddy Joel is the founder of Case Study Buddy and a freelance conversion copywriter. He specializes in helping B2B businesses like SaaS, digital agencies, and their clients better understand their customers, optimize their conversion funnels, and drive more customers to action with compelling copy. Lily Ray Senior Director, SEO & Head of Organic Research, Amsive Digital @lilyraynyc | @​​amsive_digital Lily Ray is the Sr. Director, SEO & Head of Organic Research at Amsive Digital, where she provides strategic leadership for the agency’s SEO client programs. Lily began her SEO career in 2010 in a fast-paced start-up environment and moved quickly into the agency world, where she helped grow and establish an award-winning SEO department that delivered high-impact work for a fast-growing list of notable clients, including Fortune 500 companies. Dr. Pete Meyers Marketing Scientist, Moz @Dr_Pete | @Moz Dr. Pete is Marketing Scientist for Seattle-based Moz, where he works with the marketing and data science teams on product research and data-driven content.Ross Simmonds CEO & Founder, Foundation Marketing @TheCoolestCool | @FoundationIncCo Ross Simmonds is the founder & CEO of Foundation, a global marketing agency that provides services to organizations all over the world ranging from some of the fastest-growing startups to global brands. He was named one of Atlantic Canada's Top 50 CEOs.Tom Capper Senior Search Scientist, Moz @thcapper | @Moz Tom heads up the Search Science team at Moz, providing research and insight for Moz's next generation of tools. Previously, he headed up the London consulting team for SEO agency Distilled and worked as a chef at a roadside grill. Wil Reynolds CEO & Vice President of Innovation, Seer Interactive @wilreynolds | @SeerInteractive Wil has been leading the charge to leverage “Big Data” to break down silos between SEO, PPC, and traditional marketing -- pulling together data from various sources to see the big picture. From fan favorites to fresh faces, it’s a pretty great start to what’s sure to be the best MozCon yet! We’ll have even more incredible speakers to reveal, including our community speaker lineup, in early 2024. But don’t wait to snag your tickets! Save $800 on MozCon 2024 now with Extremely Early Bird pricing. Fewer than 115 remain at this price point; get yours before we sell out. Register for MozCon Copied! Back to Top
